items.title: My uncanny AI valentines
items.description:
Phoebe Callas, 30, is not real, but she was an AI companion I went on a speed date with.	

Hopping over a pile of dirty snow, I arrived on a frigid February evening at a wine bar in midtown, a purple neon sign reading "EVA AI cafe." Inside, several people were seated at tables and booths, staring at phones. Servers milled about, placing mini potato croquettes and nonalcoholic spritzers on each table. Like many New York City bars, the majority of the patrons were on a date. 
Unlike every other bar, half of the dates weren't human.
As I enter, I'm shown to a table tucked away in the corner with a phone stand, a phone preloaded with the EVA AI app, and a pair of wireless headphones. An EVA AI employee doesn't explain how things wor …
Read the full story at The Verge.
items.content:

Like many New York City bars, the majority of the patrons were on a date.

Unlike every other bar, half of the dates weren't human.

As I enter, I'm shown to a table tucked away in the corner with a phone stand, a phone preloaded with the EVA AI app, and a pair of wireless headphones. An EVA AI employee doesn't explain how things wor …

Read the full story at The Verge.
items.author: Victoria Song

items.title: OpenAI Is Nuking Its 4o Model. China’s ChatGPT Fans Aren’t OK
items.description: As OpenAI removed access to GPT-4o in its app on Friday, people who have come to rely on the chatbot for companionship are mourning the loss all over the world.
items.content: As OpenAI removed access to GPT-4o in its app on Friday, people who have come to rely on the chatbot for companionship are mourning the loss all over the world.
items.author: Zeyi Yang

items.title: ALS stole this musician’s voice. AI let him sing again.
items.description: There are tears in the audience as Patrick Darling’s song begins to play. It’s a heartfelt song written for his great-grandfather, whom he never got the chance to meet. But this performance is emotional for another reason: It’s Darling’s first time on stage with his bandmates since he lost the ability to sing two years…
items.content: There are tears in the audience as Patrick Darling’s song begins to play. It’s a heartfelt song written for his great-grandfather, whom he never got the chance to meet. But this performance is emotional for another reason: It’s Darling’s first time on stage with his bandmates since he lost the ability to sing two years…
items.author: Jessica Hamzelou

items.title: What’s behind the mass exodus at xAI?
items.description:
The past few days have been a wild ride for xAI, which is racking up staff and cofounder departure announcements left and right. On Tuesday and Wednesday, cofounder Yuhuai (Tony) Wu announced his departure and that it was "time for [his] next chapter," with cofounder Jimmy Ba following with a similar post later that day, writing that it was "time to recalibrate [his] gradient on the big picture." The departures mean that xAI is now left with only half of its original 12 cofounders on staff. A number of staffers also took to X to announce they were leaving xAI, with some announcing that they were starting their own AI companies. 
Elon Musk's …
Read the full story at The Verge.

items.author: Hayden Field

items.title: Zillow Has Gone Wild—for AI
items.description: As the housing market stalls, Zillow’s CEO sees AI as “an ingredient rather than a threat” that can both help the company protect its turf and reinvent how people search for homes.
items.content: As the housing market stalls, Zillow’s CEO sees AI as “an ingredient rather than a threat” that can both help the company protect its turf and reinvent how people search for homes.
items.author: Steven Levy

items.title: Meta reportedly wants to add face recognition to smart glasses while privacy advocates are distracted
items.description:
Meta aims to introduce facial recognition to its smart glasses while its biggest critics are distracted, according to a report from The New York Times. In an internal document reviewed by The Times, Meta says it will launch the feature "during a dynamic political environment where many civil society groups that we would expect to attack us would have their resources focused on other concerns."
The document is from last May and reportedly describes the new "Name Tag" feature that would allow smart glasses wearers to identify people using Meta's built-in AI assistant. The New York Times reports that Meta initially planned to launch the featur …
Read the full story at The Verge.
items.content:
Meta aims to introduce facial recognition to its smart glasses while its biggest critics are distracted, according to a report from The New York Times. In an internal document reviewed by The Times, Meta says it will launch the feature "during a dynamic political environment where many civil society groups that we would expect to attack us would have their resources focused on other concerns."

The document is from last May and reportedly describes the new "Name Tag" feature that would allow smart glasses wearers to identify people using Meta's built-in AI assistant. The New York Times reports that Meta initially planned to launch the featur …

items.description: EVA AI created a pop-up romantic date night at a Manhattan wine bar to help making AI-human relationships a “new normal.”

items.title: The myth of the high-tech heist
items.description: Making a movie is a lot like pulling off a heist. That’s what Steven Soderbergh—director of the Ocean’s franchise, among other heist-y classics—said a few years ago. You come up with a creative angle, put together a team of specialists, figure out how to beat the technological challenges, rehearse, move with Swiss-watch precision, and—if you…

items.title: GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
items.description: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.
items.content: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.

items.title: RFK Jr. follows a carnivore diet. That doesn’t mean you should.
items.description: Americans have a new set of diet guidelines. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has taken an old-fashioned food pyramid, turned it upside down, and plonked a steak and a stick of butter in prime positions. Kennedy and his Make America Healthy Again mates have long been extolling the virtues of meat and whole-fat dairy, so it…

items.title: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT
items.description: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT to help organizations defend against prompt injection and AI-driven data exfiltration.

items.description: How OpenAI built a real-time access system combining rate limits, usage tracking, and credits to power continuous access to Sora and Codex.
